Leave It To Beaver Season 1 (1957)
S01E03 The Black Eye, S01E04 The Haircut

S01E03 The Black Eye
First aired: 10/18/1957 
Beaver comes home with a black eye and Ward is upset when he learns that Beaver didn&#039;t fight back. This leads Ward to teach Beaver how to defend himself. Little does Ward know, the person who punched Beaver is a girl, not to mention she&#039;s Violet Rutherford, the daughter of one of Ward&#039;s co-workers.
Cast: Hugh Beaumont (Ward Cleaver), Barbara Billingsley (June Cleaver), Tony Dow (Wally Cleaver), Jerry Mathers (Theodore "Beaver" Cleaver)
Guest cast: Burt Mustin (Gus), Richard Deacon (Fred Rutherford), Jeri Weil (Judy Hensler) , Lonnie Thomas (Boy #2), Tommy Berwald (Boy #3), Wendy Winkelman (Violet Rutherford), Richard Smiley (Boy #4), Julie Bennett (Waitress), Philip Greisman (Boy #1)
Writer: Joe Connelly, Bob Mosher, Hendrik Vollaerts 
Director: Norman Tokar

S01E04 The Haircut
First aired: 10/25/1957 
After losing his lunch money for three days in a row, Ward gives Beaver one last chance, by letting him handle his haircut money. However, when he loses that too, Beaver decides to give himself a haircut just days before he&#039;s scheduled to be an angel in a play.
Cast: Hugh Beaumont (Ward Cleaver), Barbara Billingsley (June Cleaver), Tony Dow (Wally Cleaver), Jerry Mathers (Theodore "Beaver" Cleaver)
Guest cast: Benny Baker (Barber), Gil Frye (Mr. Tyne)
Writer: Bill Manhoff 
Director: Norman Tokar
